speaker: Poppy
text: Hey, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Poppy.

speaker: Poppy
text: You should have your hearing checked.  I've been yelling "wait up!" for the last four blocks.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excusing_] Well, I must be getting old.

speaker: Poppy
text: Like an old man can walk that fast!  You were practically running the last block.  Did I ever tell you about my uncle who ran everywhere?  He ran to the store...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_puts his hand up_] That's a very interesting story.  Yes, I'll see you at the station, okay? [_notices Roz at a front table_] Roz!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank God you were here.

speaker: Roz
text: I know exactly how you feel.  Last week I ducked into a bathroom stall to get away from her and there were three other women already in there.  Listen, I have a favor to ask.  This friend of mine is running this charity dinner dance Friday night...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, say no more.  What do they need?  An autographed picture for their silent auction?

speaker: Roz
text: That would be a silent auction!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny.

speaker: Roz
text: No, what I was hoping you'd do is buy a couple of tickets. They're only a hundred bucks each.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know Roz, I'd have to take a date.  Seattle does have certain expectations about the sort of person I'm to be seen with.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's easy! [_points out Niles who has just entered the caf e_] Here he is!  Let's see if he's free.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_playing along_] I'll let you know! _Roz gets up, greets Niles, and exits.  Niles greets Frasier and sits with him._

speaker: Niles
text: Mind if I join you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I'm not staying, I'm avoiding someone.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, who?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_points Poppy out_] The new so-called arts critic at the station, Poppy!

speaker: Niles
text: [_knowingly_] A-ha.

speaker: Frasier
text: The woman drives me mad, she gasses on endlessly about the most mundane matters.  Absolutely infuriating - [_noticing Niles's grin_] - as is that smirk of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sorry if I've noticed that not a day goes by that you don't badmouth this woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, with good reason.  The woman is a windsock.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm wondering if someone isn't protesting a bit too much. She's very attractive, obviously well-bred.  Perhaps all this "Pigtails and Inkwells" hostility is actually a veiled attraction.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh, bravo Dr. Crane!  Yes, I think you're really on to something there.

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh, where's Roz gone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, she dashed off to the office.  We're going to continue our meeting there.  You know, Poppy, I was just telling my brother what an enchanting storyteller you are.  Why don't you take my seat, and he can find out for himself? [_he seats her_] Ta-ta.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, nice to finally meet you, Poppy.  There must be quite a story behind that name.

speaker: Poppy
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: So... You're the new arts critic at the station, that must be interesting.

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, well if you don't feel like talking, I should be really running along anyway. [_starts to get up_]

speaker: Poppy
text: No, don't go.  I am just amazed at how different you are from your brother.  He's sort of intimidating, I get so flustered around him, I just start babbling.  But you, you're different. You're very warm.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  So are you.

speaker: Poppy
text: Polite, not to mention stylish and charming, [_getting carried away_] and incredibly handsome.  Oh my God!  Am I babbling again?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pleased_] If you were, I'd be too polite and charming to tell you. [_laughs_] _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier enters his apartment that afternoon to find a half-naked lady on the phone.  All she is wearing is a bath towel._

speaker: Regan
text: [_on phone_] Well, what the hell are you doing? _Frasier looks at the scene and exits the room again.  In the hallway, he checks the door number and sees it is his own.  He ponders and wonders if he's gone mad before entering again to find the same scene._

speaker: Regan
text: [_on phone_] I've been waiting for twenty minutes. [_hangs up and then to Frasier_] I am so sorry.  You're probably wondering who I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm mildly curious.

speaker: Regan
text: I got into the shower - my shower.  I just moved in next door. I probably should have started with that, huh? [_shakes his hand_] I'm Regan Shaw, by the way.  Anyway, the doorbell rang, and I figured it was the phone guy because I've been waiting all day long.  I ran to catch him, and stepped out into the hallway and locked myself out.  Luckily your father came along.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that was lucky.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, well this should keep you nice and warm and I'll just run in the kitchen and get you your herbal tea.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you'll excuse me, I'll just show my father where it's kept. _Martin and Frasier enter the kitchen where Martin sets about pouring the herbal tea._

speaker: Martin
text: Pretty sweet, eh?  I found her right out in the hall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'm sorry Dad, but you can't keep her.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I've brought her here for you.  I've been talking you up the whole time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Listen, I've served this one to you on a platter.  In fact, if it wasn't for the jasmine on your robe, I'd say this one was a slam-dunk.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just...

speaker: Martin
text: It's a basketball phrase.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know that, Dad.  I want to chat up a half naked woman without looking uncouth.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just be friendly, you know.  She's a veterinarian, she's single, she's very athletic, as you can tell from that body.  And Lord... [_thinks about body_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Just because you're serving the cake doesn't mean you can't have a few crumbs that drop off. _Frasier and Martin enter the living room.  Martin hands over the herbel tea to Regan._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi.  Well, here we go.  There you are.  Now, I've got a call to make so Frasier'll keep you entertained.

speaker: Regan
text: Thanks for the tea.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't mention it. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you're next door?  Oh, that's right.  Judge Gilroy moved in with his daughter.

speaker: Regan
text: I bet he never wandered into your apartment wearing a towel.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but I did hear he wandered into work one day wearing a towel, though.  I guess that's why he had to move in with his daughter. [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: Looks like I walked off with your car keys.  I should have known from the big [_stresses and jingles the keys_] BMW on it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Regan, that's an unusual name.  Is it by any chance from...

speaker: Regan
text: From "King Lear," yeah.  One of the ungrateful daughters. I don't know what my dad was thinking. Never do. I'm sorry, I have some issues with my father.

speaker: Martin
text: [_obviously prying_] Excuse me again.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea what that would be like!  What?!

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands around_] Well, I better be on my way, huh?  Just let you two talk.  He's a wonderful listener.  In fact, that's his motto on his very popular radio show, "I Listen."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, don't forget my sign off: "Goodbye!" _Martin laughs, hits him on the head with the spoon and exits to his room._

speaker: Regan
text: I actually listen to your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, I'm flattered, thank you.

speaker: Regan
text: I think if I hadn't gone into veterinary medicine it would have been psychology.  Think I was just always drawn to animals.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is hard not to love them. _Frasier begins stroking Eddie rather harshly before eventually picking him up and putting him on his knee.  Frasier smiles at Regan as if he's loving it.  FADE TO:_ **SPY VS. SPY**  _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is sat on the couch with his head in his hands as Martin stands by his chair._

speaker: Martin
text: I just feel so responsible.  Maybe there was something more I could have said, something more I could have done.  I keep playing it over and over in my head.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll ask her out today, Dad. _Meanwhile, Daphne and Niles are coming up to the apartment in the elevator._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, do you believe women have an intuition about men?

speaker: Niles
text: Intuition?

speaker: Daphne
text: Like they might know when a man has a little crush.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, by the way he fidgets or gets a look in his eye or... _Niles cannot stop fidgeting and eventually tries leaning on the elevator side.  He inadvertently presses the fire alarm.  He quickly turns it off._

speaker: Daphne
text: I only ask because I'm getting that feeling from your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: [_relieved_] Really, huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's all moony-eyed today, someone he's quite keen on.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually I know who it is.  I called him on it yesterday in the coffee shop, he won't admit to it.  The problem is...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah?

speaker: Niles
text: I've developed a crush myself and it happens to be... _The elevator comes to a halt.  The doors open to reveal Frasier standing with Eddie in his arms._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?  Whatcha doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Niles.  How are you?

speaker: Niles
text: [_hangs his coat up_] Well.  The question is, how are you? I hear you're been running around like a love sick schoolboy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who told you that?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, let's just say that the birds around here are chirping. Anyway... are you prepared to admit that my little theory yesterday was correct?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you talking about Poppy?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, the woman you so adamantly denied having any attraction to.

speaker: Frasier
text: I still do, she's loathsome.

speaker: Niles
text: Does it gall you so much to admit I'm right?

speaker: Frasier
text: But you're not right.

speaker: Niles
text: So, well then, who is this person you're so interested in?

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't know her.

speaker: Niles
text: Tell me about her.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's premature.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, brother!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine, if you must know.  The woman happens to be...

speaker: Regan
text: [_o.s_] Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispers_] Her, my next door neighbor.

speaker: Niles
text: [_not believing_] Oh, what good timing she has!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, come in.

speaker: Regan
text: I just wanted to return this tea cup. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, you're welcome any time.  Er, Regan Shaw, this is my brother, Dr. Niles Crane. _Niles and Regan exchange nervous greetings.  They obviously recognize each other._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you two know each other?

speaker: Regan/Niles
text: Yes./No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll just get us all some coffee and you two can decide if you know each other or not.

speaker: Regan
text: I'm so sorry, Dr. Crane.  I just was a little startled seeing you outside your office.

speaker: Niles
text: Please, don't even think about it, have a seat. [_they sit_] Well, so I gather this is your new building.

speaker: Regan
text: Yes.  Right next door to your brother who I just met.  Is that so strange?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, remember, I have a policy of total confidentiality. [_Daphne enters_] He never needs to know that you've started seeing me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, here it is. _Daphne picks up an ashtray and takes it back into the kitchen where Frasier is pacing around._

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you find out?

speaker: Daphne
text: It sounded like they've had a date or two.  He mentioned having seen her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn him!

speaker: Daphne
text: Come to think of it, he said something in the elevator about having a crush on someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just have to confront him and see if he's man enough to admit he's horned in on my territory.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, excuse me, Dr. Crane, but didn't your brother meet her first?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, honestly, Daphne, just try to keep up.  It's not that complicated!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here we are.

speaker: Regan
text: Actually, I can't stay.  I've got the heating man coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Regan
text: Can I take a rain check?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, certainly.  Would you like to go out for coffee some time?

speaker: Regan
text: Yeah, I'd like that.  Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.  Bye.

speaker: Niles
text: [_calls_] Bye. _Frasier opens the door for her.  When she exits he slams the door and looks around at Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, I do take it you two know each other.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we met briefly at some event. [_pours a coffee_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Changing the subject completely, Daphne just mentioned that you happen to have a little crush on someone yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sighs_] Yes, I have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Care to elaborate?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I will.  Unlike you, I don't mind being candid.  The woman is Poppy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not believing_] Poppy?!

speaker: Niles
text: We had coffee yesterday after you left.  You're not upset?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all.  Thank you for your candor, Niles.  I'm sure you and Poppy will be very happy together. [_smirks and laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: Are you laughing at me? [_rises to his feet_] You think so little of my chances?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Niles. [_a bad tone_] I wish you and Poppy the very best!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't need this smug attitude of yours. [_gets his coat_] I fully intended to discuss this amiably.  You refuse, so I'll just say goodbye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well, thanks for dropping by, off you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: What kind of a fool does he take me for?  He is obviously pursuing Regan, the man has the nerve to say he's chasing Poppy.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_shocked_] Poppy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as if anyone could pursue that insufferable air hoi! Well, if it's deceit and chicanery he's after, I'll give him more than he can handle.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, before it gets to that level, wouldn't it make sense for you two just to have one open and honest conversation?

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly, Daphne, how you manage to overreact in absolutely everything! _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is seated at a table as Roz crosses to him and pulls up a chair. _

speaker: Roz
text: These shoes are killing me, I can't wait to sit down.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulls chair back_] Well, you're not going to sit there.

speaker: Roz
text: Why not? [_pulls chair back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulls chair back_] I'm expecting someone for coffee.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, Niles is small, we can share.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not Niles, will you stop saying that?  I'm meeting a woman.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sits_] Well, I'll move when she gets here.  By the way, I still have four tickets left for that charity ball Friday night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Roz, thanks anyway.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, it's for a good cause.  They provide disaster relief.

speaker: Poppy
text: Hi, partners! [_crosses to them_] Frasier, I was leaving the booth and I found this umbrella. [_hands it over_] I think it belongs to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's my emergency umbrella.  I always leave it in the booth.

speaker: Poppy
text: Don't feel bad, I'm forgetful too! _Niles enters from the toilets at the back and notices Poppy as she cradles Frasier's head in sympathy.  Poppy exits._

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I'll just go and see what's keeping my latte.  Would you watch my table please, Roz? _As Frasier goes to see the waitress he passes Niles on the other side of the room.  They stare at each other like two cowboys from a western movie.  Niles arrives at Roz's table._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.  I noticed that Poppy was here.  Did she mention where she was headed?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  Listen, Niles, can I interest you in a couple of tickets for a charity ball this Friday?  It's a great event.

speaker: Niles
text: Is Frasier going?

speaker: Roz
text: No, but do you have to go everything together?

speaker: Niles
text: I'll take two. [_does so_] I'm in a hurry, I'll send you a check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where was Niles in such a rush off to?

speaker: Roz
text: I have no idea. [_waves tickets_] Last chance, I only have two tickets left.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought there were four?

speaker: Roz
text: Niles just bought a pair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn him!  He's probably off to intercept Regan right now.

speaker: Roz
text: Who?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Roz, I'm in a hurry.  I'll write you a check for these.  Enjoy the table! _Frasier takes the tickets and runs out, leaving Roz cashless.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - The Charity Ball. In a set nearly identical to the one used in "Moon Dance" with the exact same music, everybody is milling about and dancing to light music.  Poppy enters on the arm of Niles._

speaker: Poppy
text: This is the best kind of party.  You get to dress up, have a wonderful time, and it's all for a good cause.

speaker: Niles
text: You know it really is for an impressive organization.  I've heard that within twenty-four hours of any worldwide disaster they can put together a ball. [_Poppy laughs_]

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh, look it's your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: What?  Oh, so it is.  Why don't you find our table and I'll get us some champagne.

speaker: Poppy
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Roz, you didn't tell me Frasier was going to be here.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, he bought the last two tickets.

speaker: Niles
text: After he knew I'd be here with Poppy.  Obviously he wants to get a shot at her himself, he bought that pull-a-long as his beard.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shocked_] Frasier's interested in Poppy?

speaker: Niles
text: I shouldn't be surprised the subtle signs of attraction are lost on you.  A woman for whom the gunning of a Harley engine is like a come-hither look.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see that Niles has brought himself a "date" to the evening.

speaker: Roz
text: Yep, and you'll never guess what he thinks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I know exactly what he thinks.  He's using Poppy as his patty, steal a few minutes with Regan, try and win her for himself.

speaker: Roz
text: That's not what he thinks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: He likes Poppy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear simple, Roz.  After six years of listening at my feet. Have you learnt nothing of the dark forces that move people? Open your ears! _Frasier crosses back to Regan.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Three - The Charity Ball. Time has lapsed.  Frasier is dancing with Regan as Niles is dancing with Poppy.  However Frasier and Niles are just staring at each other._

speaker: Regan
text: You're looking at your brother again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sorry.  It's just that he keeps staring over here. For God's sakes, he hasn't paid any attention whatsoever. Can you imagine how that woman must feel?

speaker: Regan
text: [_knowingly_] Yeah, women hate that.

speaker: Niles
text: He's doing it again.

speaker: Poppy
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: My brother is staring at us.  Obviously thinking what a striking couple we make.  In fact, let's give him something to stare at. _Niles and Poppy do a little move where Niles pushes Poppy away from him on his arm and brings her back in.  However, she falls on Niles's toe and hurts him._

speaker: Poppy
text: I'm sorry.  Same toe as before.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, same toe as before. [_laughs_]

speaker: Regan
text: What is going on with you two tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you'd find out sooner or later anyway.  See, I know about you and Niles.

speaker: Regan
text: You do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  But it's all right, I don't mind.  It's just that, well, he's really quite smitten with you.

speaker: Regan
text: Oh my God, really?

speaker: Poppy
text: Do you think you're going to lose the nail?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I just need to sit down. _Niles sits in agony as the tango music starts up.  Where have we heard that before?!_

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh my God, I love the tango.  You won't mind if I dance one with your brother?

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually Poppy...

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh come on, Niles can keep Regan company. _Poppy stands and shoves her chair in, crippling Niles's toe again. Frasier and Poppy begin to tango._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Regan, I'm getting a second wind.  Shall we show them how it's done?

speaker: Regan
text: Well, actually, Dr. Crane-

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't be so formal.  We're not doctor and patient tonight!

speaker: Poppy
text: Your brother's quite romantic, inviting me to a ball on our very first date.  He certainly doesn't waste time, does he?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, he doesn't!

speaker: Regan
text: You do realize that I'm interested in your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean, you're developing real feelings for him?

speaker: Regan
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you might think so now, but trust me: You're future's not with him.  I know this is confusing. [_twirls her round in a dizzy daze_] You'll see everything more clearly when I've got you on the couch.

speaker: Regan
text: [_disgusted_] Oh! _Meanwhile, Poppy and Frasier do a little move as Frasier, unwillingly, traces down her body._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can't take anymore of this.

speaker: Niles
text: I have to cut in.

speaker: Poppy
text: How romantic!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] Yes, come with me.

speaker: Niles
text: You should be ashamed of yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Your tango wasn't so impressive, either.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm talking about your behaviour tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: I won't simply stand aside and let you have the woman you want.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly, obviously one of us has to back off, not just tonight but permanently.

speaker: Regan
text: Frasier, can I talk to you for a moment alone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, just give me one more moment with my brother.

speaker: Poppy
text: Niles, when you're finished I'd love one more dance.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, I'll be right there.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I believe she has made her choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I believe she has. _They both look as if they have won.  Niles goes to Poppy and Frasier to Regan as the song "On The Street Where She Lives" from Bernard Shaw's "My Fair Lady" is played by the orchestra._

speaker: Regan
text: Frasier, I think I'd like to leave if that's all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Leave?  Already?  Well, couldn't we just have one last dance?

speaker: Regan
text: Well, I guess.  I'm just feeling a little uncomfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I certainly don't blame you.  You see, now I've spoken with him, Niles has agreed to behave himself.  Now I can put all my attention on you.

speaker: Regan
text: That is a relief.  I mean, you can understand why I was kinda freaked out by all that.

speaker: Regan
text: Right?  Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: He's a brave little soldier, isn't he?  Awash in despair and yet he dances.

speaker: Poppy
text: This is when they wrote songs that were really about something.  True love, broken hearts.

speaker: Niles
text: [_referring to Frasier but arguably in his heart referring to the last time he was in the ball room and Daphne broke his heart_] Yes, there's nothing quite so poignant as someone with a broken heart, pretending that it isn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: No wonder, he keeps staring over at us.  He's suffered such a crushing defeat tonight.

speaker: Regan
text: Can we go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, that's the best thing to do.  You know, let me just have one last word with him.

speaker: Regan
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if you don't mind.

speaker: Poppy
text: You guys are going to wear me out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I see you at the bar, please?

speaker: Regan
text: I think I'm going to catch a cab.

speaker: Poppy
text: Aren't you having a good time?

speaker: Regan
text: Frankly, no.  Are you?

speaker: Poppy
text: Oh, yes, I think Niles has got quite a little crush on me.

speaker: Regan
text: Actually, Poppy, there's something you should know about Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I just wanted to let you know that I'm not happy with the way things have ended this evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, neither am I.  How could I be?  And the worst thing is: it's not just tonight.  What happens when we keep running into each other?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, the victor will have his trophy.  The loser will be empty-handed.

speaker: Niles
text: It hardly seems worth it, given the permanent damage this could do to our relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I can't help but wonder if perhaps we're being a bit short-sighted.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, is that Regan and Poppy leaving just now?

speaker: Niles
text: It was, wasn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I want you to go after her.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I won't stand in your way.

speaker: Niles
text: No, Frasier, I would feel better if you went after her.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I couldn't do that to you.

speaker: Niles
text: I think we're both feeling the same thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know we are.  You noble bastard.

speaker: Niles
text: Right back atcha.  Oh, it's for the best.

speaker: Frasier
text: After all, the most important thing is our friendship.

speaker: Niles
text: I think that's worth drinking to. [_to waiter_] Two bourbons.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, while we're at it, let's propose a toast to the one pretty remarkable woman.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she'd have to be to have won both of our hearts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, then...

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: To Regan!/To Poppy! _Niles's glass freezes on its way to his lips.  Frasier, less lucky, gets half a sip in his mouth, and it stays there, as comprehension sinks in._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_swallows_] I think we're going to need two more here. _They throw back the rest of their bourbons, then slam their glasses down and bury their faces.  End of Act Two._
